page.title: 11Canterbury Entertainment (1)
page.content: There are many things to do in Canterbury. One could visit the 986 seater Marlowe{Theatre}for Â£3 - Â£4.50 and watch a veriety of things, including opera, ballet, plays and comedies. Smaller, but more intimate, is the Gulbenkian Theatre which is at the {University.}It has 300 seats, costing only Â£1.50 for adults. Performed here are mainly amateur productions and {concerts}of classical music. Then there is the ABC{cinema}which shows films ranging from adult films to cartoons. There are children's films in the holiday and films for teenagers and adults in the week. If you take your child after 6 pm you only have to pay the child's price. You can see more unusual films at the University Film Theatre.
